#198

- Growing solitarily in open mixed oak/hickory woodland near edge.
- Nearby Trees: Chinkapin Oak, Shagbark Hickory, Northern Red Oak, Bur Oak, Black Oak, distant Elm and Black Walnut.

- Smell: Unique, and pleasant, almost floral.
- Taste: Pleasant.
- KOH: Orange on pileipellis, light orange on trama, lighter orange on hill face, and turning the red on stipe to light orange.
